Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2008 07:06PM jcs13 wrote: Sassa, You and I share similar bc traits (small tumor,bad biology).  I'm having a muga test tomorrow to check the heart and should start on chemo within the next week or two.  I will be on Taxol w/Hercpetin for 12 weeks; a brief break; and then 6 weeks of radiation.  What kind of chemo where you on?  JCS

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2008 07:17PM jcs13 wrote: Sassa: Thanks....forgot to say I'll be on the Herceptin for a total of 12 months as well.  12 weeks of Taxol seems like a lot....wondering if they are giving me smaller doses over longer period of time.  (My first oncologist was not recommending chemo or Herceptin; I think going more aggressive is the right course of action.) JCS
Posts.Title: Scared!!!! how do I prepare for chemo thedudess buckie

Posts.Content: Feb 29, 2008 05:04AM jcs13 wrote: I agree with the majority....something doesn't sound right that the surgeon doesn't want to go the less invasive route by performing sentinel node biopsy.  And yes, go with a breast surgeon who knows how to properly perform the sentinel node disection.   My surgeon (a general surgeon assigned to me by the hospital breast center) told me how successful my sentinel biopsy was ....he only had to take two nodes.   I then got the pathology report to see he actually pulled 14.  I am so angry!!!!!
Posts.Title: Questioning surgeon Carly68 roseg

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2008 03:12AM jcs13 wrote:  Started 12 weeks of Taxol/Herceptin on February 15th; my third chemo is tomorrow.  So far, I'm feeling GREAT.  I have not side effects at all.  I am told that the chemo is cumulative, however, I'm hoping that I continue to feel as good as I am.
Posts.Title: Taxol Side Effects Dragonfly92127 shelloz1

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2008 04:43AM jcs13 wrote: I was diagnosed in November, 2007 with IDC.  It was a very small tumor (.5 cm), node negative, but was grade 3 and HER2+.  My first onco advised radiation only; the 2nd felt that we needed to go after the biology of the tumor, which was very aggressive, and not the size.  I'm going with the more aggressive approach.  Staring chemo very soon (12 wks of Taxol w/Herceptin, followed by 6 weeks of radiation).   12 wks sounds like a lot to me, but perhaps they give a lower dosage of chemo and spread it out.  I'm assuming I'll have a port, but don't know this yet (one of my many questions on my list to ask the onco.)   I welcome any shared experiences or thoughts on this. ~Joan
Posts.Title: chemo or no chemo sonnebe peapot

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2008 01:20AM jcs13 wrote: I started chemo on February 15th (Taxol weekly for 12 weeks w/ Herceptin; continue the Herceptin for a year).  I had my 3rd round yesterday.  So far, no reaction to the Taxol.  Have experiencd a few sleepless nights probably due to the steroids I get prior to the Taxol.  The hair is staying in....I'm assuming it will go, not sure when though.  So far, I'm counting my blessings.
